name: DeobfuscationSort
author: Simi Flix
about: Sorts and deobfuscates movies and tv shows.
requirements: This script requires Python 3.11 or above to be installed on your system.
description: This script is based on `VideoSort` by Andrey Prygunkov.
It is applicable only for downloaded TV shows and movies.
In addition to `VideoSort`'s comprehensive renaming functionality,
obfuscation suffixes from the downloaded files' names.

options.name: MoviesDir
description: The option defaults to empty, which results in using the global DestDir or CategoryX.DestDir

options.name: SeriesDir
description: Destination directory for seasoned TV shows.
The option defaults to empty, which results in using the global DestDir or CategoryX.DestDir

options.name: DatedDir
description: Destination directory for dated TV shows.
The option defaults to empty, which results in using the global DestDir or CategoryX.DestDir

options.name: OtherTvDir
description: Destination directory for other TV shows.
The option defaults to empty, which results in using the global DestDir or CategoryX.DestDir

options.name: TvCategories
description: Comma separated list of categories for TV. DeobfuscationSort automatically
distinguishes movies from series and dated TV shows. But it needs help
to distinguish movies from other TV shows because they are named
using same conventions. If a download has associated category listed in
Category names must match categories defined in NZBGet.

options.name: VideoExtensions
description: Only files with these extensions are processed. Extensions must

options.name: SatelliteExtensions
description: Move satellite files such as subtitles to the destination along with
the files they are related to. Extensions must be separated with commas.

options.name: MoviesFormat
description: %t, %.t, %_t    - movie title with words separated with spaces, dots
Common specifiers (for movies, series and dated tv shows):
%^dn, %.dn, %_dn - directory name with words separated with spaces, dots
%^dN, %.dN, %_dN - directory name with words separated with spaces, dots
%^fn, %.fn, %_fn - filename with words separated with spaces, dots
%^fN, %.fN, %_fN - filename with words separated with spaces, dots
%cat, %.cat, %_cat - category with words separated with spaces, dots

options.name: SeriesFormat
description: Formatting rules for seasoned TV shows.
%sn, %s.n, %s_n - show name with words separated with spaces, dots
For a list of common specifiers see option <MoviesFormat>.

options.name: MultipleEpisodes
description: This option is used for seasoned TV shows when the video file includes multiple episodes. For example: the formatting
string "S%0sE%0e", combined with "MultipleEpisode=list" and "EpisodeSeparator=E" will result in a file named
"My.Show.S01E01E02E03". "MultipleEpisode=range" and "EpisodeSeparator=-E" will result in a file named
"My.Show.S01E01-E03.mkv". The "range" option is useful to follow the TV episode naming conventions of popular media

options.name: EpisodeSeparator
description: The option is used for seasoned TV shows when video file includes
multiple episodes, e. g. "My.Show.S01E02-03.mkv". The option defines
a character (or a string) which must be insterted between episode
numbers. For example, if "EpisodeSeparator=E", the specifier "%0e"
will expand to "02E03". Giving formatting string "%sN - S%0sE%0e" the
resulting filename will be "My Show - S01E02E03.mkv".

options.name: SeriesYear
description: Treat year following title as part of title.
For seasoned TV shows: if year in the file name goes directly after
show name, it will be added to show name. This may be necessary for
media players like XBMC, Boxee or Plex (or anyone using TheTVDB) to

options.name: DatedFormat
description: Formatting rules for dated TV shows.
%sn, %s.n, %s_n - show name with words separated with spaces, dots
For a list of common specifiers see option <MoviesFormat>.

options.name: OtherTvFormat
description: Formatting rules for other TV shows.
All specifiers are same as in option <MoviesFormat>.

options.name: LowerWords
description: List of words to keep in lower case.

options.name: UpperWords
description: List of words to keep in upper case.

options.name: DeObfuscateWords
description: List of words to strip from obfuscated release names (comma-separated).
The script will remove these words after a hyphen in the directory name,
restoring the original title. For example, 'Movie.Title-OBFUSCATION' becomes 'Movie.Title'.

options.name: ReleaseGroups
description: List of known scene or warez groups to ensure case preservation.

options.name: DNZBHeaders
description: NZB-sites may provide extended information about videos,
which is usually more confident than the information extracted

options.name: PreferNZBName
description: Use name of nzb-file instead of name of video file.
Good indexer nzb-sites do renaming and cleanup of nzb-file
names making them a better choice to extract name information
than the original video file names.
NOTE: If download contains more than one video file suitable
for renaming (having correct extension and bigger than <MinSize>)
this option is ignored and the names of video files are always used.

options.name: Overwrite
description: If not active the files are still moved into destination but
unique suffixes are added at the end of file names, e.g. My.Show.(2).mkv.

options.name: Cleanup
description: If after successful sorting all remaining files in the download directory
are smaller than "MinSize" the directory with all files is removed. If no.
files could be processed, the directory remains untouched.

options.name: Preview
description: When active no changes to file system are made but the destination
file names are logged. Useful to test formating rules; to restart
the script use "Post-Process-Again" on history tab in NZBGet web-interface.

options.name: Verbose
description: For debugging or if you need to report a bug.
